revised_title: The Function and Structure of the Rectal Complex in Mealworms
tldr: The author investigates the rectal complex of mealworms, specifically the cryptonephric condition, where the distal ends of Malpighian tubules are closely applied to the rectum. The rectal complex helps in removing water from the faeces by increasing the osmotic pressure of the fluid in the perinephric chamber, making it easier for the rectal epithelium to absorb water and nutrients from the faecal waste.
